main event: A civilian in Dayton, Ohio reported seeing a silvery colored object, the size of a head of a pin, with a stationary circular motion. The observation lasted less than 10 minutes and was concluded to be a balloon based on the wind direction and velocity on the day of the sighting.
interesting points: The object was seen as a silvery colored stationary circular object, very small in size.
The observation was determined to be a balloon release based on the wind direction and velocity at the time of the sighting.
The observation lasted less than 10 minutes.
The witness could not be certain of the object's speed or distance from them.
The witness suggested that the object may have been a weather balloon or a result of malfunctioning equipment.
